page.title: 06Operation Skylark Stirling
page.content: Operation Skylark, a countryside playscheme for young people 8_12 years old, organised by the Smith Institute, the Stirling District Countryside Ranger Service and the Scottish Conservation Project is held in August for one week, from Monday to Friday, and costs 10p per day. All the materials are provided apart from a packed lunch. You queue up before 9am to choose your morning and afternoon activity. The activities include Woodwork, Spinning, Photography, Tennis, Pottery, Drama & Orienteering. Each workshop lasts for about 3 hours. Some people who have been there before said that they learned a lot from it. The guides were very helpful and patient and helped everyone. Canoeing is held in the University, tennis in the Kings Park and orienteering is held near the Wallace Monument.
